task_summary: Pick up the red object (cylinder) from the table using a single-arm manipulator with visual confirmation, approach, grasp, then lift and place back onto the table.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base robot arm interacts with a red cylinder placed on a black table. The arm first perceptually locates the object using vision, opens the gripper, approaches above the red object, and then executes a grasp with minimal force. After establishing a secure grasp, it lifts the object above the table surface and places it back onto the table. Throughout the procedure, visual and grasp verification checkpoints are included for reliability.
preconditions: Red cylindrical object is on the table and unobstructed.
Robot arm is initialized, homed, and gripper is functional.
Vision system is operational for object localization.
stepwise_plan: Check if red object is visible; scan if not.
Detect and locate the red object.
Approach and align with the object precisely.
Close gripper gently to grasp object.
Verify object is in the gripper.
Move above the table to target area.
Place the object down onto the table.
success_criteria: Red object is picked up from its initial position.
Object is placed securely on the table without rolling or falling.
No damage to the object or gripper.
failure_and_recovery: If the object is not visible: scan and retry detection.
If grasp is unstable: re-attempt alignment and grasp.
If gripper fails to open or close: reset gripper and retry.
If object slips during transfer: return to perceive and retry grasp.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after object is released on the table and robot retreats.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is currently visible to the vision system.
Scans the workspace in a raster pattern to find the red object.
Runs a detection pass to localize the red object precisely.
Opens the gripper to a suitable width for grasping the object.
Moves the end effector above the red object with 5cm offset.
Aligns and approaches the object with tight tolerance.
Closes the gripper with minimum force.
Checks that the red object is grasped and held in the gripper.
Moves the end effector above the table to prepare for placement.
Lowers and places the object onto the table surface.
Opens gripper to release the red object.
Moves the end effector away from the table to complete the task.

recovery_strategy: Retry scan and detection up to 3 times.
Reattempt grasp if object not acquired.
assumptions: The red object is consistently a cylinder (labeled 'red_cylinder') as seen in all frames.
The object and scene remain static across all framesâ€”no indication of motion or additional objects.
Instruction does not specify post-grasp placement (the object remains on the table per frames) and is interpreted accordingly.
Frame evidence overrides stricter interpretation of moving the object elsewhere.

expected_success_criteria: Red cylinder is picked up and placed back onto the table by the robot.
